intro: Luisia latilabris, commonly known as the broad-lipped luisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Luisia latilabris thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in high-altitude ecosystems.
